comments.content:
I'm having this problem also. Everithing else seems to be worjing (nova list, nova hypervisors list, glance image-list, etc).

I'm using CentOS 7.2 with Liberty (2 controllers with HA, 2 network nodes, 2 rabbitmq servers with HA, 1 compute) + DVR.

In my controllers' logs I get something like this:

comments.content: Could you please provide the steps to reproduce this particular error? Does it happen whenever you try to launch an instance or just intermittently? If you are unable to reproduce it yourself, please provide that information as well. Thanks!
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~auggy

comments.content: Also, I'm not sure if this is related, but it looks like there's another bug with this similar issue that was closed as invalid as it turned out to be a configuration issue - https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1517224
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~auggy

comments.content:
For me, it happens every time, I haven't been able to create a VM so far.

But I think you're right Augustina, and it's a misconfiguration on my part.
I checked the bug report you mantion and I don't have those lines in my controllers, only in my compute.

I'll add those lines and report back.

Thank you!
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ricardo-barberis

comments.content:
Victory!  \o/

I confirm that after adding the missing lines to nova.conf in my controllers, instances get properly created from CLI and dashboard.

Thanks again!
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ricardo-barberis

comments.content: Thanks Ricardo, glad that helped! If you were following documentation maintained by OpenStack that omitted that information, please provide a link and I can create a bug for them to update it.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~auggy

comments.content:
I followed this guide:

http://docs.openstack.org/liberty/install-guide-rdo/nova-controller-install.html#install-and-configure-components


I could have sworn it didn't have this section a couple of weeks ago (I went through it a few times, scripting the installation) but now it does:

"In the [DEFAULT] section, enable support for the Networking service:

[DEFAULT]
...
network_api_class = nova.network.neutronv2.api.API
security_group_api = neutron
linuxnet_interface_driver = nova.network.linux_net.NeutronLinuxBridgeInterfaceDriver
firewall_driver = nova.virt.firewall.NoopFirewallDriver"

So I guess you can close this issue if the OP doesn't mind.

Thanks!
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ricardo-barberis

comments.content: [Expired for OpenStack Compute (nova) because there has been no activity for 60 days.]
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~janitor
